title: rdenkye
author: rdenkye
content: In the visualization of public keys associated with Satoshi's wallets, a distinct '2' message can be seen near the middle of the right edge.https://github.com/orhan2akdogan/Satoshi-Walletshttps://prnt.sc/GfK9HK5m0WYT

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: This is just your brain making a pattern with random dots.But for fun, let's say its not. Then you're suggesting Satoshi not only has some control over the text of the keys that are being generated for mining, but that he would have counted on somebody plotting this data in the same way in the future. I don't think he did either of these things.You're also suggesting that all of these addresses definitively belonged to Satoshi, which has never been proven.QuoteThus, after Hal Finney, you will have made your second known transactionSatoshi sent BTC to Dustin Trammell as well as Hal Finney so it would be the 3rd.

comments.author: JiiBs
comments.body: Quote from: nutildah on January 09, 2025, 08:35:56 PMThis is just your brain making a pattern with random dots.But for fun, let's say its not. Then you're suggesting Satoshi not only has some control over the text of the keys that are being generated for mining, but that he would have counted on somebody plotting this data in the same way in the future. I don't think he did either of these things.You're also suggesting that all of these addresses definitively belonged to Satoshi, which has never been proven.QuoteThus, after Hal Finney, you will have made your second known transactionSatoshi sent BTC to Dustin Trammell as well as Hal Finney so it would be the 3rd.Spot on.Iâ€™ve keenly looked and I could see other alphabets and numbers there, just the brain trying to make meaning of what is completely randomized before your input or receptor sense organ.

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.body: Quote from: rdenkye on January 09, 2025, 07:00:53 PMIn the visualization of public keys associated with Satoshi's wallets, a distinct '2' message can be seen near the middle of the right edge.You missed the K down and to the left. It is clear that the signal is "2K", and you should be asking satoshi to send you 2K bitcoins instead.

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Quote from: odolvlobo on January 10, 2025, 04:02:16 AMYou missed the K down and to the left. It is clear that the signal is "2K", and you should be asking satoshi to send you 2K bitcoins instead.Or it may be satoshi challenging OP to an NBA 2K game on playstation.Am I the only one who sees this "2" as a "1"?

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: Could this have been a successor to Braille instead? I mean, it makes a lot of sense to print this as raised dots and then only readable by someone with third sight.Joking aside, I believe this is clear and unrefutable evidence that satoshi was not only responsible for spreading malware, but that he used ill-gotten gains he made as the creator of the Y2K bug. That's the problem with millennials.
